item.title: Python CheatSheet
item.description: Python there is no switch statement. bools are capitalized True/False to iterate over numbers: for i in range(n): read one line from standard input: input() write one line to standard output: print(...) write without a newline: print(..., end="") functions and fields use snake_case classes should be capitalized. the null type is None / is floating point division, // is integer division. collections have no size or length method, use len(.
